ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ fʉʼó ŋwɛ́, atsɔ́ guɔ gwoon fùɔ Ezekiyásè tà ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ye legwé. Esǎyà ntsẅìnkʉ̀ Ssé gẅie aa míŋ Ámɔ́sè wembàŋa tó ńgyá yé ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: «Anò gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gɔ̌ɔn á yɔ̀ɔn: Táŋte tsìŋendá jú, ńtí nue ɔ̀ ge kwé, ɔ̀ těen ńgee ńtsẅɛ́ɛ wɔ́.»
en: In those days   Hezekiah became terminally ill.  # 20:1 2Ch 32:24 The prophet Isaiah  # 20:1 Is 1:1; 2:1 son of Amoz came and said to him, “This is what the Lord says: ‘Set your house in order, for you are about to die; you will not recover.’ ”  # 20:1 2Sm 17:23

ngiemboon: Ezekiyásè júʼ púʼu, ńtém nzèm ńnáa ssé ndá, é sẅíŋte Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ńgɔɔn ngie:
en: Then Hezekiah turned his face to the wall   and prayed to the Lord,

ngiemboon: «Tsetsɔ́ʼ me Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, e sẅíŋte gú, kímte páʼ n ka lɔgɔ pyennɛ́ ńgiŋ páʼ ɔ̀ ne ńkwoŋo, ḿbú ńná letʉ́m sɔ́ɔn mbwó gù, ńgÿo pɔ́ mmó gie á ge poŋo gú!» Ezekiyásè gɔɔn púʼu, ḿbú ńdʉa.
en: “Please, Lord, remember   how I have walked before you faithfully and wholeheartedly and have done what pleases you.”  # 20:3 Lit what is good in your eyes,# 20:3 2Kg 18:3–6 And Hezekiah wept bitterly.  # 20:3 2Sm 12:21–22

ngiemboon: Á láa púʼu, Esǎyà nyé te gʉa tà ńkúu gyɛ̌ nɔʼ, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a tsẅi né yé ngie
en: Isaiah had not yet gone out of the inner courtyard when the word of the Lord came to him:

ngiemboon: Piŋ nzèm ńgɔɔn mbwó Ezekiyásè gẅie aa fùɔ láʼ yɔ́ɔn, ngie: «Mèŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé Fùɔ Ndavîd gẅie aa mángʉanjʉʼ gẅi, n juʼú sẅíŋtè jú, ńgyá ntse nÿɔ́g mú, n ge gÿo ɔ̀ zeŋe; à gwɔ́ na mbɔ́ɔntè lyɛ̌ʼ tá, ɔ̀ gíŋe ńgʉa ndá Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: “Go back and tell Hezekiah, the leader   of my people, ‘This is what the Lord God of your ancestor David says: I have heard your prayer;  # 20:5 Ps 39:12 I have seen your tears. Look, I will heal you. On the third day from now you will go up to the Lord’s temple.

ngiemboon: N ge gíŋe kẅiʼi mengùʼ ntsɔ̀b tʉ̂a né legém na mengùʼu láʼ mú, n ge kẅé gẅí lâ Yelúzálèm na mbwó fùɔ Asili; n ge kábte yɔɔn tÿǒsoŋ, ɔ̀ lɔgɔ ńzẅɛ́ʼɛ wég fùɔ Ndavîd gẅie aa ngàŋafàʼ wɔ̀ɔn.»
en: I will add fifteen years to your life. I will rescue you and this city from the grasp of the king of Assyria. I will defend this city for my sake and for the sake of my servant David.’ ”

ngiemboon: Esǎyà gɔɔn ngie: Pi pí membaŋ pÿɛ̀ me njǔm ńgwɔʼ ńzába na fʉ̌ŋ, mé pí ńzába mǒ, Ezekiyásè leen ńké sẅéte.
en: Then Isaiah said, “Bring a lump of pressed figs.” So they brought it and applied it to his infected skin, and he recovered.

ngiemboon: Ezekiyásè zɛ́te ngie: «N ge lɔgɔ yɛ̌ liŋé tá zsé ngie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ge gÿo e sẅéte tà e gwaa gwɔ́ mbɔ́ɔntè lyɛ̌ʼ tá, n gíŋe ńgʉa ndá yé?»
en: Hezekiah had asked Isaiah, “What is the sign   that the Lord will heal me and that I will go up to the Lord’s temple on the third day? ”

ngiemboon: Esǎya gɔɔn né yé ngie: «Cʉ̀apʉa ge nyɛɛ gú liŋé gie á nyɛɛ ngie à ge gÿo mmó gie à la kaʼ. Aliŋé gie à ge gÿo ɔ̀ gyá, á yɔɔn: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ge fó na gù, ésẅɛʼte jʉ́jʉ́ŋ tà à zyɛ́ʼ mesetɔ̂b fʉʼ mmó Akaze legém. Kà ɔ̀ ne ńkwoŋo ngie à gʉa pɔ́ mvfò mvfò, kà à piŋ piŋ wɔ́ɔ?»
en: Isaiah said, “This is the sign   to you from the Lord that he will do what he has promised: Should the shadow go ahead ten steps or go back ten steps? ”

ngiemboon: Ezekiyásè tsɔ́ʼ ngie: «Jʉ́jʉ́ŋ lézyɛ́ʼ ńgʉa mvfò na mesetɔ̂b legém, á zeŋe tɛʼ. N ne ńkwoŋo ngie à piŋ piŋ.»
en: Then Hezekiah answered, “It’s easy for the shadow to lengthen ten steps. No, let the shadow go back ten steps.”

ngiemboon: Ńgɔɔn púʼu, Esǎya ntsẅìnkʉ̀ Ssé sẅíŋte Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, á gÿo jʉ́jʉ́ŋ piŋe na mesetɔ̂b fʉʼ mmó Akaze legém mie à zɔ̌ɔn ńzyɛ́ʼ.
en: So the prophet Isaiah called out to the Lord, and he brought the shadow   back the ten steps it had descended on the stairway of Ahaz.  # 20:11 Tg, Vg; DSS read on the steps of Ahaz’s roof chamber; Is 38:8,# 20:11 Jos 10:12–14; Is 38:8

ngiemboon: Á la gíŋ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ fʉʼó ŋwɛ́, Melondag-Mbalandaŋ gẅie aa míŋ Mbalandaŋ, ńgwɔ́ fùɔ Mbambilonia júʼ ngie Ezekiyásè ka guɔ, ńtúm memámekěm ngie pɔ́ gʉa ńnáa ŋwàʼne pɔ́ mmó nanǎ né yé.
en: At that time   Merodach-baladan  # 20:12 Some Hb mss, LXX, Syr, Tg, some Vg mss, Is 39:1; other Hb mss read Berodach-baladan son of Baladan, king of Babylon, sent letters and a gift to Hezekiah since he heard that he had been sick.

ngiemboon: Ezekiyásè kẅé wɔ́b, ńdɔgɔ wɔ́b ńkʉ́ʼʉ tsɛ̀ɛ nɔʼ yé, ńnyɛɛ wɔ́b ndá gie mé leʼe shúm tʉ̀nzẅìŋ wó, ńnyɛɛ wɔ́b nkáb, ńnyɛɛ wɔ́b tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ, ńnyɛɛ wɔ́b mevɛ́ lɔg ńzɔ́ʼɔ nyìŋ; ńgÿo melaméndɔ̀ɔn. Ńgíŋe ńnyɛɛ wɔ́b ntaŋ shúm ncù pâ shúm tʉ̀nzẅìŋ sé ntsèm. À la pú te lÿoon wɔ́b tsɔ́ mmó gie á laa tsɛ̀ɛ nɔʼ yé kà gie aa tsɛ̀ɛ láʼ yé wɔ́ɔ wɔ́.
en: Hezekiah listened to the letters and showed the envoys his whole treasure house #— #the silver, the gold, the spices, and the precious oil #— #and his armory, and everything that was found in his treasuries. There was nothing in his palace and in all his realm that Hezekiah did not show them.

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn nò tɔ́g, Esǎyà ntsẅìnkʉ̀ Ssé tó ńzɛ́te fùɔ Ezekiyásè ngie: «Epʉ̀a pɔɔn shwóŋo gú ngie kɔ́? Pɔ́ kɔʼɔ́ ńzɔɔn fóo lé nzɔ̌?» Ezekiyásè tsɔ́ʼ ngie: «Pɔ́ kɔʼɔ́ fóo lé tàa ngʉ̀a shʉ̀shʉ̀a, á Mbambilonia»
en: Then the prophet Isaiah came to King Hezekiah and asked him, “Where did these men come from and what did they say to you? ”

ngiemboon: Esǎyà gíŋe ńzɛ́te ngie: «Pɔ́ gyá kɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ nɔʼ jú?» Ezekiyásè tsɔ́ʼ ngie: «Pɔ́ gyá shúm ntsèm sie ée tsɛ̀ɛ nɔʼ yɔ́ɔn, n kaa gʉa na shúm tʉ̀nzẅìŋ sɔ́ɔn ńdÿoon wɔ́b tsɔ́ mmó wɔ́.»
en: Isaiah asked, “What have they seen in your palace? ”

ngiemboon: Á cʉa púʼu, Esǎyà gɔɔn né Ezekiyásè ngie: «Júʼu shwóŋè Cʉ̀apʉ̀a:
en: Then Isaiah said to Hezekiah, “Hear the word of the Lord:

ngiemboon: Etsɔ́ melyɛ̌ʼ ge gÿo gwɔ́ wó mie mé ge kaa mmó ntsèm gie áa tsɛ̀ɛ nɔʼ gù, mbɔɔ shúm ntsèm sie metá pú lǎ cúʼte tà ńtyé lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn, é lɔg gʉa né Mbambilonia tà tsɔ́ mmó le vʉʼʉ, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a zɔ gɔɔn púʼu.
en: ‘Look, the days are coming when everything in your palace and all that your predecessors have stored up until today will be carried off to Babylon; nothing will be left,’   says the Lord.

ngiemboon: Mé ge láʼ gʉa tsetsɛ̀ɛ penkʉ́ pú pembàŋa pie ɔ̀ zyě, é gwoon wɔ́b, éshʉ́ʉ wɔ́b, é lɔgɔ wɔ́b gÿo megàŋafàʼ tsɛ̀ɛ nɔʼ Mbambilonia.»
en: ‘Some of your descendants #— #who come from you, whom you father #— #will be taken away,   and they will become eunuchs  # 20:18 Or court officials in the palace of the king of Babylon.’ ”  # 20:18 Dn 1:3–7,11

ngiemboon: Ezekiyásè tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó Esǎyà ngie: «Ayɔɔn shwóŋè Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gie ɔ̀ shwóŋo wɔ́ɔn lɔɔn áa mbòŋ.» Á gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie: «Ńdɔgɔ ngie n dɔɔn ńnyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ wó mbà pege ge gẅiin mbʉ́lè, é piŋ ńnéŋe té pɔ́g.»
en: Then Hezekiah said to Isaiah, “The word of the Lord that you have spoken is good,”   for he thought, “Why not, if there will be peace and security during my lifetime? ”

ngiemboon: Apfwɔ̀ʼɔ píte menò Ezekiyásè, á nò na we lezèŋe nnɛ́ ntsèm, á nò na ntí gie à la lɔg ńtúŋo tâŋ ntse, mbɔɔ sóŋ Akendug, ńdɔg ńtsege ntse ńná tÿǒsoŋo Yelúzálèm, ée se ŋweʼe tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwàʼne mezẅìŋe menò mefùɔ pà Yúndà.
en: The rest of the events of Hezekiah’s reign, along with all his might and how he made the pool   and the tunnel and brought water into the city,  # 20:20 2Ch 32:30 are written in the Historical Record of Judah’s Kings.  # 20:20 2Kg 16:19

ngiemboon: Ezekiyásè la ńkwé, míŋ we Manase jÿó ndá ye ńcʉ́ʼʉ fùɔ.
en: Hezekiah rested with his ancestors, and his son Manasseh became king in his place.
